title: Missing name property in errors
body:
We ran into an issue with the Cloudinary code where an error is causing an uncaught promise rejection in serverless code.

We tracked the issue down to Serverless' logging code which expects errors to have a `name` property. I think the Serverless code is reasonable considering that JS `Error` prototypes have `name`.

I propose adding a `name` property to errors. I ran into this in the `uploader.js` code. I'm not sure where else this might be an issue.

Is this possible to do?

title: Uploading SVG data urls will result in an errno":-36,"code":"ENAMETOOLONG"
body:
SVG data urls are no longer recognized because the regex in isRemoteUrl doesn't take svg+xml as a mime type into account.

The following regex is used in isRemoteUrl: 
/^ftp:|^https?:|^gs:|^s3:|^data:([\w-]+\/[\w-]+)?(;[\w-]+=[\w-]+)*;base64,([a-zA-Z0-9\/+\n=]+)$/

To match SVG data urls it should probably be like this:
/^ftp:|^https?:|^gs:|^s3:|^data:([\w-]+\/[\w-]+(\+([\w-]+)?)?(;[\w-]+=[\w-]+)*;base64,([a-zA-Z0-9\/+\n=]+)$/
or like this
/^ftp:|^https?:|^gs:|^s3:|^data:([\w-]+\/[\w-+]+)?(;[\w-]+=[\w-]+)*;base64,([a-zA-Z0-9\/+\n=]+)$/

because the mime type for an SVG data url looks like this: 
data:image/svg+xml;base64,

The current regex will not match because of the + between svg and xml. This means that with the current code the data url for a SVG file is not seen as remote and the whole of the data url is being used as the name of the file.

title: text upload doesn't upload with options
body:
Hi!

I had an issue while trying to upload custom text styles through the nodejs API (https://cloudinary.com/documentation/upload_images#creating_images_from_text).

I found out what the issue was but still have a question about the behaviour.

So the issue is that, the text function in uploader.js filters the user's options with the utils.only function, but the second argument is not spreaded (should be ...TEXT_PARAMS instead of TEXT_PARAMS, according to the comments above the utils.only function).

My question is the following: Why did you choose to spread ? What's the advantage in spreading the object argument instead of just passing the object and looping on it normally ?

Thanks !

title: root_folders ignores params
body:
The root_folders endpoint ignores any passed parameter. E.g. limiting the results or paginating.

Example:
`await cloudinary.v2.api.root_folders({'max_results': 1, 'next_cursor': nextCursor});`

This request will still return 2000 results instead of just one.

In our case this causes a huge problem because we have more than 2000 folders and can't iterate through them to get a complete list of our folders.

needed which reduces the complexity of this project.

Note that nodejs version 12 was added to the travis test suite.

title: Add proxy support
Fixed bug in utils encode_key_value
Added automatic JavaScript linting and fixed existing formatting errors
body:
As discussed, the PR was divided into multiple commits so it is easier to grok and approve.

All the commits except the last one (5c2f766) are fixes for errors and inconsistencies discovered through linting.

The last commit contains the additions needed to let anyone lint the project by running `npm run lint`. Those using supporting code editors and IDEs (e.g., VS Code) will benefit from ESLint highlighting errors in their editor as they code.

In a future PR, linting can be added as a pre-commit hook to ensure that all commits comply with the accepted code standard, quality is maintained, less bugs are introduced, and balance is restored to the force.

You will notice that in the [ESLint config file](https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_npm/blob/5c2f76627ce0fb77f07a7b6c6f9c52f79be7af94/.eslintrc.json) I have disabled many of the linting rules. This was done so as to limit the number of meaningful changes to the code that had to be introduced in this PR, and yet still allow ESLint to pass.

The rules in lines [40-73](https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_npm/blob/5c2f76627ce0fb77f07a7b6c6f9c52f79be7af94/.eslintrc.json#L40) in particular are ones I believe we should enforce. For example: [no-dupe-keys](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-dupe-keys) has found places where the code erroneously uses the same key twice in an object definition [(utils_spec.js)](https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_npm/blob/master/test/utils_spec.js#L1226), there are variables that are defined but never used, class constructors that are empty and redundant, unreachable code (usually code that comes after a return statement), and more.

title: Add support for remote/local function invocation (fn:remote and fn:wasm)
Support different radius for each corner (containing images and overlays)
body:
Added support for a radius option which can receive a number, a string (containing either the value or a colon separated list of values), or an array of numbers and/or strings.


Replaces #258

title: Escape quotes in HTML attributes
body:
When creating an HTML tag encodes quotes inside attributes using HTML entities.

**Semantic nitpicking**: In all the SDKs this function is called `escapeQuotes` but what it actually does is encode quotes, not escape them. Renaming the functions should be relatively painless as this is an internal private function and should not affect the public API.

title: Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open
body:
Currently I am having trouble upload a image through using the line: 

`const result = await cloudinary.v2.uploader.upload(req.body.fileName,  
        function(error, result) {
            console.log(result, error); 
        });`

where `req.body.fileName` is the image name "myimagename.jpg" (I printed this information to make sure this is what it was).  `req.body.fileName`  is the name of the image a user uploads through an input. 

`<input type="file" name="image" id="image" onChange ={this.fileSelectedHandler}/>

I am getting the error 

> { [Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 
[0]   errno: -4058,
[0]   code: 'ENOENT',
[0]   syscall: 'open',
[0]   path:
[0] (node:30052) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: #<Object>
[0] (node:30052) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Unhandled promise rejection. This error originated either by throwing inside of an async function without a catch block, or by rejecting a promise which was not handled with .catch(). (rejection id: 2)

I  know the error ENOENT shows up  when the file is not in the corresponding directory...but that is because the jpg is not in the directory, rather I am trying to have users upload an image from an <input> , then that image being converted into a cloudinary URL

Any help would be appreciated. Thank  you

title: Remove coffee script dependencies and transform
body:
The browserify transform defined in `package.json` was causing my build to fail due to coffeescript not being a listed dependency.

Seeing as the source code have been refactored in JavaScript, there's no need for the transform anymore. This removes any last trailing references to coffescript.

title: Uploading with Buffer won't keep original name
body:
Hello,

we are having the same issue as in https://github.com/cloudinary/cloudinary_npm/issues/181

Uploading via `cloudinary.uploader.upload_stream()` won't keep the original name running the latest cloudinary package.

**Buffer locks like this:**
`{ fieldname: 'files',
    originalname: '6.jpg',
    encoding: '7bit',
    mimetype: 'image/jpeg',
    buffer:
     <Buffer ff d8 ff e0  ... >,
    size: 715228
 },`

**Response from the upload_stream() is:**
`{ public_id: 'jpxft8q6mj6fvdokt6d7',
    version: 1550746854,
    signature: '7dae8ea9ab5a0f2c4567e15bb83adce89f420a83',
    width: 1600,
    height: 1201,
    format: 'jpg',
    resource_type: 'image',
    created_at: '2019-02-21T11:00:54Z',
    tags: [],
    bytes: 715228,
    type: 'upload',
    etag: 'a4b10e79a754917e5aaea2647ef9fbe9',
    placeholder: false,
    url:
     'http://res.cloudinary.com/.../jpxft8q6mj6fvdokt6d7.jpg',
    secure_url:
     'https://res.cloudinary.com/.../jpxft8q6mj6fvdokt6d7.jpg',
    original_filename: 'file' },`

As you can see the `original_filename` is 'file' instead of '6'.
